Is Cache expensive?

Cache, OK
StateOklahoma
Population2,842

In comparison to nearby areas, Cache is a bit more expensive, and it is substantially less expensive compared to the entire country. Compared to the city of Oklahoma City however, it is a bit less expensive.

Home prices

Cache's median home value is $133,100. It is about $8,240 (6%) higher in comparison to nearby areas. In comparison to the entire country it is about $84,400 (38%) lower, and is about $25,400 (16%) lower in comparison to the city of Oklahoma City.

Rents

Cache's median monthly rent is $725. In comparison to nearby areas it is approximately $133 (15%) lower. In comparison to the nation as a whole it is about $337 (31%) lower, and it is roughly $146 (16%) lower in comparison to the city of Oklahoma City.

Nearby places

Medicine Park

Medicine Park is approximately 9 miles northeast from Cache. Housing prices there are a lot more expensive. The median home in Medicine Park is valued at $226,200, which comes out to $93,100 (41%) higher than Cache. Rents there are a bit more expensive. Medicine Park's median rent is $975 a month, which is $250 (25%) higher than Cache.

Lawton

Lawton is about 9 miles east from Cache. The real estate prices there are somewhat less expensive. The cost of the median home in Lawton is $112,800, which comes out to $20,300 (17%) lower than Cache. The rent there is a little more expensive. Lawton's median monthly rent is $832, which comes out to $107 (12%) higher than Cache.

Faxon

Faxon is about 12 miles south of Cache. Its housing prices are pretty similar. The median home price in Faxon is $131,300, which is $1,800 (1%) lower than Cache. The rent there is a little less expensive. Faxon's median monthly rent is $663, which works out to $62 (9%) lower than Cache.

Chattanooga

Chattanooga is about 15 miles south from Cache. Its housing prices are significantly less expensive. The value of the median home in Chattanooga is $78,100, which works out to $55,000 (70%) lower than Cache. Its rents are a little more expensive. The median monthly rent in Chattanooga is $1,054, which is $329 (31%) higher than Cache.

Geronimo

Geronimo is about 15 miles southeast of Cache. Its housing prices are a lot less expensive. The value of the median home in Geronimo is $75,900, which works out to $57,200 (75%) lower than Cache. The rent there is a bit more expensive. In Geronimo the median monthly rent is $764, which is $39 (5%) higher than Cache.
